intro: Crotalaria arushae, commonly known as the Arusha crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features striking yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals, and it grows as an erect shrub or small tree. Its leaves are palmately compound, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Crotalaria arushae is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
